1.verse: Paul, Silas  ( A ) and Timothy, ( B )

2.verse: We always thank God for all of you ( E ) and continually mention you in our prayers. ( F )

3.verse: We remember before our God and Father ( G ) your work produced by faith, ( H ) your labor prompted by love, ( I ) and your endurance inspired by hope ( J ) in our Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: For we know, brothers and sisters  loved by God, ( K ) that he has chosen you,

5.verse: because our gospel ( L ) came to you not simply with words but also with power, ( M ) with the Holy Spirit and deep conviction. You know ( N ) how we lived among you for your sake.

6.verse: You became imitators of us ( O ) and of the Lord, for you welcomed the message in the midst of severe suffering ( P ) with the joy ( Q ) given by the Holy Spirit. ( R )

7.verse: And so you became a model ( S ) to all the believers in Macedonia ( T ) and Achaia. ( U )

8.verse: The Lord’s message ( V ) rang out from you not only in Macedonia and Achaia—your faith in God has become known everywhere. ( W ) Therefore we do not need to say anything about it,

9.verse: for they themselves report what kind of reception you gave us. They tell how you turned ( X ) to God from idols ( Y ) to serve the living and true God, ( Z )

10.verse: and to wait for his Son from heaven, ( AA ) whom he raised from the dead ( AB ) —Jesus, who rescues us from the coming wrath. ( AC )

1.verse: You know, brothers and sisters, that our visit to you ( A ) was not without results. ( B )

2.verse: We had previously suffered ( C ) and been treated outrageously in Philippi, ( D ) as you know, but with the help of our God we dared to tell you his gospel in the face of strong opposition. ( E )

3.verse: For the appeal we make does not spring from error or impure motives, ( F ) nor are we trying to trick you. ( G )

4.verse: On the contrary, we speak as those approved by God to be entrusted with the gospel. ( H ) We are not trying to please people ( I ) but God, who tests our hearts. ( J )

5.verse: You know we never used flattery, nor did we put on a mask to cover up greed ( K ) —God is our witness. ( L )

6.verse: We were not looking for praise from people, ( M ) not from you or anyone else, even though as apostles ( N ) of Christ we could have asserted our authority. ( O )

7.verse: Instead, we were like young children  among you.

8.verse: so we cared for you. Because we loved you so much, we were delighted to share with you not only the gospel of God ( Q ) but our lives as well. ( R )

9.verse: Surely you remember, brothers and sisters, our toil and hardship; we worked ( S ) night and day in order not to be a burden to anyone ( T ) while we preached the gospel of God to you.

10.verse: You are witnesses, ( U ) and so is God, ( V ) of how holy, ( W ) righteous and blameless we were among you who believed.

11.verse: For you know that we dealt with each of you as a father deals with his own children, ( X )

12.verse: encouraging, comforting and urging you to live lives worthy ( Y ) of God, who calls ( Z ) you into his kingdom and glory.

13.verse: And we also thank God continually ( AA ) because, when you received the word of God, ( AB ) which you heard from us, you accepted it not as a human word, but as it actually is, the word of God, which is indeed at work in you who believe.

14.verse: For you, brothers and sisters, became imitators ( AC ) of God’s churches in Judea, ( AD ) which are in Christ Jesus: You suffered from your own people ( AE ) the same things those churches suffered from the Jews

15.verse: who killed the Lord Jesus ( AF ) and the prophets ( AG ) and also drove us out. They displease God and are hostile to everyone

16.verse: in their effort to keep us from speaking to the Gentiles ( AH ) so that they may be saved. In this way they always heap up their sins to the limit. ( AI ) The wrath of God has come upon them at last.

17.verse: But, brothers and sisters, when we were orphaned by being separated from you for a short time (in person, not in thought), ( AJ ) out of our intense longing we made every effort to see you. ( AK )

18.verse: For we wanted to come to you—certainly I, Paul, did, again and again—but Satan ( AL ) blocked our way. ( AM )

19.verse: For what is our hope, our joy, or the crown ( AN ) in which we will glory ( AO ) in the presence of our Lord Jesus when he comes? ( AP ) Is it not you?

20.verse: Indeed, you are our glory ( AQ ) and joy.

1.verse: So when we could stand it no longer, ( A ) we thought it best to be left by ourselves in Athens. ( B )

2.verse: We sent Timothy, ( C ) who is our brother and co-worker ( D ) in God’s service in spreading the gospel of Christ, ( E ) to strengthen and encourage you in your faith,

3.verse: so that no one would be unsettled by these trials. ( F ) For you know quite well that we are destined for them. ( G )

4.verse: In fact, when we were with you, we kept telling you that we would be persecuted. And it turned out that way, as you well know. ( H )

5.verse: For this reason, when I could stand it no longer, ( I ) I sent to find out about your faith. ( J ) I was afraid that in some way the tempter ( K ) had tempted you and that our labors might have been in vain. ( L )

6.verse: But Timothy ( M ) has just now come to us from you ( N ) and has brought good news about your faith and love. ( O ) He has told us that you always have pleasant memories of us and that you long to see us, just as we also long to see you. ( P )

7.verse: Therefore, brothers and sisters, in all our distress and persecution we were encouraged about you because of your faith.

8.verse: For now we really live, since you are standing firm ( Q ) in the Lord.

9.verse: How can we thank God enough for you ( R ) in return for all the joy we have in the presence of our God because of you? ( S )

10.verse: Night and day we pray ( T ) most earnestly that we may see you again ( U ) and supply what is lacking in your faith.

11.verse: Now may our God and Father ( V ) himself and our Lord Jesus clear the way for us to come to you.

12.verse: May the Lord make your love increase and overflow for each other ( W ) and for everyone else, just as ours does for you.

13.verse: May he strengthen your hearts so that you will be blameless ( X ) and holy in the presence of our God and Father ( Y ) when our Lord Jesus comes ( Z ) with all his holy ones. ( AA )

1.verse: As for other matters, brothers and sisters, ( A ) we instructed you how to live ( B ) in order to please God, ( C ) as in fact you are living. Now we ask you and urge you in the Lord Jesus to do this more and more.

2.verse: For you know what instructions we gave you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.

3.verse: It is God’s will ( D ) that you should be sanctified: that you should avoid sexual immorality; ( E )

4.verse: that each of you should learn to control your own body  ( F ) in a way that is holy and honorable,

5.verse: not in passionate lust ( G ) like the pagans, ( H ) who do not know God; ( I )

6.verse: and that in this matter no one should wrong or take advantage of a brother or sister.  ( J ) The Lord will punish ( K ) all those who commit such sins, ( L ) as we told you and warned you before.

7.verse: For God did not call us to be impure, but to live a holy life. ( M )

8.verse: Therefore, anyone who rejects this instruction does not reject a human being but God, the very God who gives you his Holy Spirit. ( N )

9.verse: Now about your love for one another ( O ) we do not need to write to you, ( P ) for you yourselves have been taught by God ( Q ) to love each other. ( R )

10.verse: And in fact, you do love all of God’s family throughout Macedonia. ( S ) Yet we urge you, brothers and sisters, to do so more and more, ( T )

11.verse: and to make it your ambition to lead a quiet life: You should mind your own business and work with your hands, ( U ) just as we told you,

12.verse: so that your daily life may win the respect of outsiders ( V ) and so that you will not be dependent on anybody.

13.verse: Brothers and sisters, we do not want you to be uninformed ( W ) about those who sleep in death, ( X ) so that you do not grieve like the rest of mankind, who have no hope. ( Y )

14.verse: For we believe that Jesus died and rose again, ( Z ) and so we believe that God will bring with Jesus those who have fallen asleep in him. ( AA )

15.verse: According to the Lord’s word, we tell you that we who are still alive, who are left until the coming of the Lord, ( AB ) will certainly not precede those who have fallen asleep. ( AC )

16.verse: For the Lord himself will come down from heaven, ( AD ) with a loud command, with the voice of the archangel ( AE ) and with the trumpet call of God, ( AF ) and the dead in Christ will rise first. ( AG )

17.verse: After that, we who are still alive and are left ( AH ) will be caught up together with them in the clouds ( AI ) to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord ( AJ ) forever.

18.verse: Therefore encourage one another ( AK ) with these words.

1.verse: Now, brothers and sisters, about times and dates ( A ) we do not need to write to you, ( B )

2.verse: for you know very well that the day of the Lord ( C ) will come like a thief in the night. ( D )

3.verse: While people are saying, “Peace and safety,” ( E ) destruction will come on them suddenly, ( F ) as labor pains on a pregnant woman, and they will not escape. ( G )

4.verse: But you, brothers and sisters, are not in darkness ( H ) so that this day should surprise you like a thief. ( I )

5.verse: You are all children of the light ( J ) and children of the day. We do not belong to the night or to the darkness.

6.verse: So then, let us not be like others, who are asleep, ( K ) but let us be awake ( L ) and sober. ( M )

7.verse: For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who get drunk, get drunk at night. ( N )

8.verse: But since we belong to the day, ( O ) let us be sober, putting on faith and love as a breastplate, ( P ) and the hope of salvation ( Q ) as a helmet. ( R )

9.verse: For God did not appoint us to suffer wrath ( S ) but to receive salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ. ( T )

10.verse: He died for us so that, whether we are awake or asleep, we may live together with him. ( U )

11.verse: Therefore encourage one another ( V ) and build each other up, ( W ) just as in fact you are doing.

12.verse: Now we ask you, brothers and sisters, to acknowledge those who work hard ( X ) among you, who care for you in the Lord ( Y ) and who admonish you.

13.verse: Hold them in the highest regard in love because of their work. Live in peace with each other. ( Z )

14.verse: And we urge you, brothers and sisters, warn those who are idle ( AA ) and disruptive, encourage the disheartened, help the weak, ( AB ) be patient with everyone.

15.verse: Make sure that nobody pays back wrong for wrong, ( AC ) but always strive to do what is good for each other ( AD ) and for everyone else.

18.verse: give thanks in all circumstances; ( AG ) for this is God’s will for you in Christ Jesus.

19.verse: Do not quench the Spirit. ( AH )

20.verse: Do not treat prophecies ( AI ) with contempt

21.verse: but test them all; ( AJ ) hold on to what is good, ( AK )

23.verse: May God himself, the God of peace, ( AL ) sanctify you through and through. May your whole spirit, soul ( AM ) and body be kept blameless ( AN ) at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. ( AO )

24.verse: The one who calls ( AP ) you is faithful, ( AQ ) and he will do it. ( AR )

25.verse: Brothers and sisters, pray for us. ( AS )

26.verse: Greet all God’s people with a holy kiss. ( AT )

27.verse: I charge you before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers and sisters. ( AU )

28.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. ( AV )
